intro: Megaclinium congolanum, commonly known as the African sedge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along riverbanks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
